content:
We are Monash University Kendo Club, also known as MUKC. We are a Monash University Sports club, and are predominantly student-run with guidance from qualified instructors. As the name suggests, our club practices kendo, as a means of training both our minds and bodies.
We conduct one beginner’s course a year, which starts in February/March when the first university semester begins. The club holds three trainings per week. Social functions and competitions are also held throughout the year. Anyone who is interested in kendo is more than welcome to come and watch our training sessions or to contact us for more information.
Among our members and instructors, are people who have international experience, and are state and national representatives. Our members come from all walks of life, are of various ages and are very welcoming. Feel free to speak to any of us before or after training when we’re hanging out outside the Games Hall where we train (see below for more info on training sessions).
Instructors  Mr Yoichi Yano (7 Dan) Mrs Noriko Matsumoto (6 Dan) Mr Kazuya Kimura (5 Dan) Mrs Kaori Dimovski (5 Dan)  Committee  President: Zishi Wang Vice President: Joshua Wildey Treasurer: N/A Secretary: Yuki Yu General Members: Kaori Dimovski & Eugene Chow Website Administrator: Mony Sak (website-admin@monashunikendoclub.org.au) [Previous years’ committee members]  Affiliations We are affiliated with the kendo governing bodies the Victorian Kendo Renmei (VKR), Australian Kendo Renmei (AKR), and the International Kendo Federation (FIK).
Events  Melbourne University joint Kendo Camp Movies and Bowling night Club BBQ … more !  Competitions we attend  Australian University Games Victorian Kendo Championships Australian Kendo Championships Otsuka and Nagae Taikai Ballarat Kendo Taikai … more !
title: About Us

content:
Are you a complete beginner? No Kendo experience? Great! We hold a 2-week beginner’s course every year, commencing week 1 of semester 1 - usually around February or March!
No experience necessary! Beginners of any age are welcome! For juniors (under 16) we will need your parent/guardian to attend registration.
All you need is comfortable workout clothes!
Not so beginner
If you have Kendo experience, and wish to join our club, please come to training and speak to one of the members. They will get you in touch with a committee member.

Regular Training You can find us training in Monash Sport, 42 Scenic Boulevard, Monash University Clayton Campus at the following times:
 Monday 6:00 pm - 8:00 pm (Games Hall) Wednesday 6:00 pm - 8:00 pm (Games Hall) Saturday 9:00 am - 10:30 am (Stadium) - senior members (training in full armour) only     How to get there The Monash Univeristy website has more information about Clayton Campus, and how to get there by public transport and inter-campus bus service.
Competition season extra training During competition season, we have extra trainings. Please check the homepage and Facebook group for the latest information regarding extra trainings.
Closed dates During the year, the club closes for holidays, usually during Christmas break and some University holidays. Please check the homepage and Facebook group for the latest information regarding closed dates.
